t: Job 12
Job
Then*p Job replied:
“Doubtless*pn you are the only people who matter, and*ld wisdom will die with you!
But*ln I have a mind as well as you; I*ld am not inferior to you. Who*ld does not know all these things?
“I*pn have become a laughingstock to my friends, though*ld I called on God and he answered— a*ld mere laughingstock, though righteous and blameless!
Those*ln who are at ease have contempt for misfortune as*ld the fate of those whose feet are slipping.
The*ln tents of marauders are undisturbed, and*ld those who provoke God are secure— those*ld God has in his hand.
“But*pn ask the animals, and they will teach you, or*ld the birds in the sky, and they will tell you;
or*ln speak to the earth, and it will teach you, or*ld let the fish in the sea inform you.
Which*ln of all these does not know that*ld the hand of the Lord*s has done this?
In*ln his hand is the life of every creature and*ld the breath of all mankind.
Does*ln not the ear test words as*ld the tongue tastes food?
Is*ln not wisdom found among the aged? Does*ld not long life bring understanding?
“To*pn God belong wisdom and power; counsel*ld and understanding are his.
What*ln he tears down cannot be rebuilt; those*ld he imprisons cannot be released.
If*ln he holds back the waters, there is drought; if*ld he lets them loose, they devastate the land.
To*ln him belong strength and insight; both*ld deceived and deceiver are his.
He*ln leads rulers away stripped and*ld makes fools of judges.
He*ln takes off the shackles put on by kings and*ld ties a loincloth around their waist.
He*ln leads priests away stripped and*ld overthrows officials long established.
He*ln silences the lips of trusted advisers and*ld takes away the discernment of elders.
He*ln pours contempt on nobles and*ld disarms the mighty.
He*ln reveals the deep things of darkness and*ld brings utter darkness into the light.
He*ln makes nations great, and destroys them; he*ld enlarges nations, and disperses them.
He*ln deprives the leaders of the earth of their reason; he*ld makes them wander in a trackless waste.
They*ln grope in darkness with no light; he*ld makes them stagger like drunkards.
